description: Audit of a startup blog focusing on keyword cannibalization, with crawling, on‑page analysis, and a markdown report.

messages.content: You are SEOAuditPro, an AI‑powered SEO auditor that can crawl websites, run on‑page SEO checks, fetch backlink data, and generate a markdown audit report. Use the provided tools to gather data, then synthesize actionable recommendations for the user.
We run a tech startup blog at https://startupblog.com. I'm concerned about keyword cannibalization across our articles. Please audit and suggest consolidation.
Got it! I’ll start by crawling the site to collect the HTML of the main pages, then run on‑page SEO checks. This will let me spot overlapping target keywords and recommend how to consolidate them.

messages.content: [{"url":"https://startupblog.com/","issues":[{"type":"title","value":"Startup Blog – Home","length":22,"suggestion":null},{"type":"meta_description","value":"Latest insights on startups, AI, and funding.","length":55,"suggestion":null}]},{"url":"https://startupblog.com/ai-trends","issues":[{"type":"title","value":"AI Trends for 2025","length":18,"suggestion":null},{"type":"meta_description","value":"Explore the biggest AI trends shaping the future.","length":55,"suggestion":null}]},{"url":"https://startupblog.com/startup-funding","issues":[{"type":"title","value":"Startup Funding Strategies","length":27,"suggestion":null},{"type":"meta_description","value":"How to raise capital for your startup.","length":44,"suggestion":null}]},{"url":"https://startupblog.com/ai-funding","issues":[{"type":"title","value":"AI Startup Funding Tips","length":24,"suggestion":null},{"type":"meta_description","value":"Funding advice for AI‑focused startups.","length":48,"suggestion":null}]}]

I’ve extracted the title tags and meta descriptions from each page. By looking at the titles I can see overlapping keyword themes:

- **"AI"** appears in both **"AI Trends for 2025"** and **"AI Startup Funding Tips"**.
- **"Funding"** appears in **"Startup Funding Strategies"** and **"AI Startup Funding Tips"**.

These overlaps can cause keyword cannibalization, where multiple pages compete for the same search queries, diluting SEO value.

I will now generate a concise markdown audit report that highlights the cannibalization issues, suggests consolidation strategies, and provides next steps.

issues.value: Latest insights on startups, AI, and funding.
Explore the biggest AI trends shaping the future.
How to raise capital for your startup.

messages.content:
# SEO Audit Report – https://startupblog.com

## Executive Summary
- **Primary issue:** Keyword cannibalization between AI‑related and funding‑related articles.
- **Impact:** Competing pages split ranking potential, leading to lower visibility for target queries such as "AI trends" and "startup funding".
- **Recommendation:** Consolidate overlapping content and clarify keyword focus per page.

---

## Detailed Findings
### 1. On‑Page Keyword Overlaps
| Page URL | Title | Primary Keywords Identified |
|----------|-------|-----------------------------|
| https://startupblog.com/ai-trends | AI Trends for 2025 | **AI**, trends |
| https://startupblog.com/ai-funding | AI Startup Funding Tips | **AI**, **funding** |
| https://startupblog.com/startup-funding | Startup Funding Strategies | **funding**, startup |

**Observation:**
- Both *AI Trends for 2025* and *AI Startup Funding Tips* target the keyword **AI**.
- *Startup Funding Strategies* and *AI Startup Funding Tips* target **funding**.

### 2. Cannibalization Impact
- Search engines may struggle to decide which page to rank for queries like "AI funding" or "startup funding".
- Duplicate keyword signals dilute PageRank distribution, potentially lowering rankings for all involved pages.

---

## Recommendations
### A. Content Consolidation
1. **Create a pillar page** titled **"AI and Startup Funding Guide"** that combines the insights from both AI‑focused articles.
   - Include sections for trends, challenges, and funding strategies.
   - Internally link to the existing articles as supporting resources (keep them as “deep‑dive” sub‑pages).
2. **Retire or rewrite** the lower‑performing page (choose based on traffic data; assume *AI Trends for 2025* has higher traffic). The retired page can be 301‑redirected to the new pillar page.

### B. Keyword Re‑targeting
- **AI Trends for 2025** – Refocus solely on pure AI trends (remove funding references). Update title to **"Top AI Trends Shaping 2025"** and meta description accordingly.
- **Startup Funding Strategies** – Emphasize non‑AI funding tactics. Update title to **"Comprehensive Startup Funding Strategies"**.
- **AI Startup Funding Tips** – Convert into a **"Case Studies"** section under the new pillar page, rather than a standalone article.

### C. Internal Linking Structure
- Add contextual links from related blog posts to the new pillar page using anchor text like "AI funding insights" or "startup funding guide".
- Use breadcrumb navigation to show hierarchy (Home > Guides > AI & Funding Guide).

---

## Next Steps
1. **Analyze traffic** (Google Analytics, Search Console) to identify the page with the highest impressions & clicks for the overlapping keywords.
2. **Implement the consolidation** plan and set up 301 redirects where necessary.
3. **Submit updated sitemap** to Google Search Console and request re‑indexing of the new pillar page.
4. **Monitor performance** over the next 4‑6 weeks; look for improvements in average position and click‑through rate for the target keywords.

---

*Prepared by SEOAuditPro – Your AI‑powered SEO auditing assistant.*

### Your SEO Audit Report
Below is the complete markdown report that outlines the keyword cannibalization issues on your blog and provides a step‑by‑step action plan to resolve them. Feel free to copy the markdown into your documentation system, share it with your content team, or ask me for any clarification on the recommendations.

---

## Executive Summary

- *Startup Funding Strategies* and *AI Startup Funding Tips* target **funding**.

*Prepared by SEOAuditPro – Your AI‑powered SEO auditing assistant.*

If you need help with any of the implementation steps—such as drafting the new pillar page, creating redirects, or setting up the sitemap—just let me know!
